biologicalProcesses.name: protein modification by small protein conjugation

annotations.annotationName: NCBI Amblyraja radiata Updated Annotation Release 100.20210331

summary.description: Predicted to enable FAT10 activating enzyme activity and ubiquitin activating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response; protein ubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to act upstream of or within several processes, including dendritic spine development; learning; and limbic system development. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Orthologous to human UBA6 (ubiquitin like modifier activating enzyme 6). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Mar 2025]

annotations.annotationName: NCBI Perognathus longimembris pacificus Annotation Release 100

biologicalProcesses.name: protein modification by small protein conjugation

summary.description: Predicted to enable FAT10 activating enzyme activity and ubiquitin activating enzyme activity. Predicted to be involved in DNA damage response; protein ubiquitination; and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Predicted to act upstream of or within protein modification process. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in hypural. Orthologous to human UBA6 (ubiquitin like modifier activating enzyme 6). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Mar 2025]

Enables FAT10 activating enzyme activity and ubiquitin activating enzyme activity. Involved in protein ubiquitination and ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process. Acts upstream of or within several processes, including dendritic spine development; learning; and limbic system development. Predicted to be active in cytoplasm and nucleus. Is expressed in cerebral cortex and gonad. Orthologous to human UBA6 (ubiquitin like modifier activating enzyme 6). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Mar 2025]

annotations.annotationName: NCBI Motacilla alba alba Annotation Release 100

biologicalProcesses.name: protein modification by small protein conjugation

annotations.annotationName: NCBI Nematolebias whitei Updated Annotation Release 100.20210725

summary.description: Modification of proteins with ubiquitin (UBB; MIM 191339) or ubiquitin-like proteins controls many signaling networks and requires a ubiquitin-activating enzyme (E1), a ubiquitin conjugating enzyme (E2), and a ubiquitin protein ligase (E3). UBE1L2 is an E1 enzyme that initiates the activation and conjugation of ubiquitin-like proteins (Jin et al., 2007 [PubMed 17597759]).[supplied by OMIM, Mar 2008]
